name: vscode-salesforce-colorg
description: Stay organized, easily identify your default org and prevent unwanted deployments with Salesforce ColORG. The extension will automatically change the color of your VScode workspace based on the Salesforce org you're currently connected to. Define the set of rules, the colors to apply and start boosting your productivity!

sf-colorg.target.statusBar.description: Apply the color to the Status Bar

sf-colorg.target.activityBar.description: Apply the color to the Activity Bar

sf-colorg.rules.description: The list of rules to identify your target orgs and the color to apply. Each rule is composed by a Regular Expression (regex) to identify the org alias and the color to apply in HEX format. If your default org matches multiples rules, only the first one will be applied

regex.description: Regular Expression to identify your default org alias

color.description: The background color in HEX format to apply to your workspace

foregroundColor.description: The foreground color in HEX format to apply to your workspace

sf-colorg.target.settingsScope.description: Specify where to apply the color settings (user or workspace JSON settings file)
